cause.description:
We are committed to providing the highest quality of service in our efforts to:

*Educate and counsel tenants and first-time home owners about their renting rights and owning options within Brooklyn's highly competitive housing market

*Organize tenants and first-time home owners within their local communities to act collectively to protect their housing rights

*Network with other community organizations to serve a broader urban housing population

*Serve as an advocate for tenants and first-time home owners, as well as a conduit of housing-related resources in the community. 1. Homeownership Program >> In the past 10 years, NHN has facilitated over 505 mortgages worth over $81.5 million. 2. Tenant Program >> From April 2001 - December 2004, Francisco stopped 109 evictions and secured $644,118 in rental assistance for very-low-income tenants. 3. Special projects >> In 2004, NHN registered 94 new voters. > NHN's Brooklyn Upstairs policy advocacy contributed to the creation of the NYS Main Street Program.
cause.mission: To empower low and moderate income Brooklyn residents to secure quality housing and build financial assets.
cause.name: Neighbors Helping Neighbors
